alert.note: Alert for Scotts Bluff; South Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 12:59AM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Scotts Bluff and southern Sioux Counties through 1230 AM MDT... At 1158 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Morrill, or 10 miles east of Torrington, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Scottsbluff, Gering, Mitchell, Terrytown, Morrill, Hubbard Hill, Scotts Bluff National Monument, Lake Alice and Henry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Cheyenne. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM MDT for the Panhandle of Nebraska.
